ru.myx.ae3.binary

Interface TransferTarget

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Abortable, AutoCloseable, java.io.Closeable

    public interface TransferTarget
extends java.io.Closeable, Abortable
    An object for non-blocking binary data consumption. It is assumed that if a target is backing some blocking operation it should enqueue absorption requests and process them somehow in background.

      • NUL_TARGET

        static final TransferTarget NUL_TARGET
        NUL TARGET instance - dummy target. It is important to use this one - since implementations can easily check for equality and perform some shortcuts while rendering something.

      • absorbArray

        boolean absorbArray(byte[] array,
                    int off,
                    int len)
        The 'array' argument's value should not be used by target after this method returned and can be freely reused many times. Target must read all required bytes before returning. TODO: check implementations to respect this ^^^^
        Parameters:

      • absorbBuffer

        boolean absorbBuffer(TransferBuffer buffer)
        TransferBuffer is a single time use object, so for target it is supposed to be safe to collect buffers, not just immediately read them. TODO: check users to respect this ^^^^
        Parameters:
        buffer -
        Returns:
        boolean

      • absorbNio

        boolean absorbNio(java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer)
        NioBuffer is a reusable object (put-flip-get-compact pattern). The 'buffer' argument's value should not be used by target after this method returned and can be freely reused many times. Target get's the buffer in {pos=start, lim=limit} state (like after call to flip()). Target can read all, some or none of the buffer, next time it could be called with the same or new buffer and reading should continue where it stopped previously. TODO: check implementations to respect this ^^^^
        Parameters:
        buffer -
        Returns:
        boolean

      • close

        void close()
        in order* FIXME: doc * Enqueues a 'close' action on completion. This action have to be launched when currently absorbed data is sent to underlying medium or when transfer is interrupted. When no data available in buffers launch should happen immediately. In any case the action will be launched in other thread, not to block current process.
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.io.Closeable

      • enqueueAction

        @ReflectionHidden
<A,R> boolean enqueueAction(ExecProcess ctx,
                                              java.util.function.Function<A,R> function,
                                              A argument)
        in order* FIXME: doc * Enqueues an action to launch on completion. This action have to be launched when currently absorbed data is sent to underlying medium or when transfer is interrupted. When no data available in buffers launch should happen immediately. In any cases the action will be launched in other thread, not to block current process. When no delayed buffering used in this target, acts like: public boolean enqueueAction( Act.Context ctx, Act.Function function, Object argument) { Act.launch(ctx, function, argument); return true; }
        Type Parameters:
        A -
        R -
        Parameters:

        function -
        argument -
        Returns:
